title: Link health checker with TabzChrome + AI validation
description:

## Implementation
1. Scheduled job (daily/weekly) queries all resources with URLs
2. TabzChrome loads each URL via tabz_open_url + tabz_get_page_info

   - 'Program discontinued' messaging

5. Flag suspicious resources in review queue

- last_checked timestamp
- http_status
- ai_health_score (0-1)
- flagged_reason if any

## Job Integration
Add to backend/jobs/ alongside existing refresh jobs
Could run as background task or scheduled cron

## Stretch Goals
- Screenshot archive for change detection
- Auto-update contact info if changed
- Notify admins of high-value resource failures

title: Hide-on-scroll-down, show-on-scroll-up header pattern
description:
Implement a smart header that hides when scrolling down and shows when scrolling up.

## Behavior
- Header visible at top of page
- Scrolling DOWN: header slides up and hides (after small threshold ~50px)
- Scrolling UP: header slides down and shows
- Creates more vertical space for content while keeping navigation accessible

## Implementation Options
1. **CSS-only**: Use `position: sticky` with negative top on scroll
2. **JS hook**: Track scroll direction, toggle classes
3. **Library**: headroom.js pattern or similar

## Example Hook
```tsx
const { scrollDirection } = useScrollDirection();
// scrollDirection: 'up' | 'down' | null
```

## Design
- Smooth animation (transform translateY)
- Shadow appears when header is floating
- Works with existing nav structure

## References
- headroom.js pattern
- Many modern sites (Medium, Twitter, etc.)
close_reason: Implemented hide-on-scroll-down header pattern with useScrollDirection hook and Header component

title: Redesign search page: header search + full-width card grid
description:
Simplify search page layout for better card density and UX:

## Current
- 3-panel layout: [Filters 280px] [Cards 2-col] [Detail 400px]

- Wastes horizontal space

1. Move search bar to site header (global)

3. Remove detail panel entirely
4. Cards expand to 3-4 columns (more when sidebar collapsed)
5. Clicking card navigates to /resources/[id] page
6. Preserve filters in URL params (?q=...&category=...&state=...)
7. Resource page has 'Back to search' that preserves filter state

## Design Philosophy
- Dense, information-rich layout (not sparse modern SaaS style)
- Fit lots of information on one page
- Collapsible sidebar saves space but keeps filters accessible
- Expandable sections keep sidebar organized

## Benefits
- 2x more cards visible
- Simpler UX (click = navigate)
- Mobile-friendly
- Shareable filtered URLs
- Browser back/forward works naturally

description:

- Click on 'Details' or similar to collapse/expand detail panel

- Quick access to restore sidebars

- Sidebar slides out horizontally (left sidebar → left, right sidebar → right)
- Card grid expands to fill space
- Small toggle icon/button remains visible at edge
- Smooth cubic-bezier transition

## State
- Remember collapsed state in localStorage
- Keyboard shortcut (e.g., `[` and `]` keys)

## Mobile
- Not applicable - mobile already uses sheet pattern

```tsx
const [leftCollapsed, setLeftCollapsed] = useState(false);
const [rightCollapsed, setRightCollapsed] = useState(false);
// Grid: lg:grid-cols-[leftCollapsed ? '0px' : '280px', '1fr', rightCollapsed ? '0px' : '400px']
```

title: Redesign search page with sidebar filters and card grid layout

<div className="grid lg:grid-cols-[280px_1fr_400px] gap-6">

- Left: Filter sidebar (280px, sticky)
- Center: Scrollable content area
- Right: Detail/feature panel (400px)

### Filter Sidebar Pattern (lines 464-553)
- Checkbox groups with Checkbox component
- Separator between filter sections
- Slider for range filters (salary → could be trust score)

### Card Layout (lines 720-828)
- ScrollArea for virtualized scrolling

- Cards with: logo, title, company, location, tags, metadata footer

### Detail Panel (lines 907-1062)

- ScrollArea inside

- Sheet for filters (lines 605-620)
